keyMoments.title: Luffy Meets Princess Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: Shirahoshi encounters Luffy for the first time when he accidentally enters the Hard-Shell Tower. Frightened and believing him to be an assassin, she fearfully asks if he has come to kill her.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the first appearance of Shirahoshi, who is later revealed to be the ancient weapon Poseidon. Her meeting with Luffy begins an important relationship that affects the entire arc.
keyMoments.quote: Are you... are you here to kill me like all the others?

keyMoments.title: Shirahoshi's Tearful Nature Displayed
keyMoments.description: Despite her enormous size as a giant mermaid, Shirahoshi is shown to be extremely emotional and prone to crying, earning Luffy's observation that she cries a lot.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Shirahoshi's core character trait of being emotionally sensitive despite her physical power, creating an interesting contrast.
keyMoments.quote: Are you... are you here to kill me like all the others?

relationships.description: Luffy is the first person to treat Shirahoshi kindly and help her overcome her fears. Their friendship becomes central to the Fish-Man Island arc.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy and Shirahoshi meet for the first time when he accidentally enters her tower.

relationships.description: Shirahoshi is King Neptune's only daughter and youngest child, treasured and protected by her father.

evolutionMoments.description: Shirahoshi's relationship to King Neptune is established through context.

reveals.information: Princess of Ryugu Kingdom and daughter of King Neptune
Extremely fearful and emotional despite enormous size, confined to Hard-Shell Tower
Has been targeted by assassins, causing her to fear strangers

keyMoments.title: Minister of the Right Debuts
keyMoments.description: The Minister of the Right appears at Ryugu Palace as one of King Neptune's chief advisors, helping to manage the royal affairs.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a key governmental figure in the Ryugu Kingdom's administration.

relationships.description: Serves as one of King Neptune's most trusted advisors and ministers.

evolutionMoments.description: Shown serving King Neptune at Ryugu Palace.

reveals.information: Minister and advisor to King Neptune

keyMoments.title: Minister of the Left Debuts
keyMoments.description: The Minister of the Left appears at Ryugu Palace as one of King Neptune's chief advisors, working alongside the Minister of the Right.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces another key governmental figure in the Ryugu Kingdom's administration.

relationships.description: Serves as one of King Neptune's most trusted advisors and ministers.

evolutionMoments.description: Shown serving King Neptune at Ryugu Palace.

reveals.information: Minister and advisor to King Neptune

keyMoments.title: Caribou Kidnaps Mermaids with Numa Numa no Mi
keyMoments.description: After being freed from his barrel, Caribou uses his Logia-type Numa Numa no Mi powers to kidnap Ishilly and other mermaids by transforming into swamp and pulling them into his body.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the dangerous capabilities of Caribou's Devil Fruit and establishes him as an active threat on Fish-Man Island.
keyMoments.quote: Kehihihi! Thank you for freeing me, little mermaids. Now you'll be coming with me!

abilities.description: Caribou can transform his body into bottomless swamp to capture and store objects and people.

reveals.information: Uses Numa Numa no Mi to kidnap mermaids

keyMoments.title: Octopako's Anime Debut
keyMoments.description: Octopako appears on Fish-Man Island. This is her anime debut, as the manga cover story where she originally appeared was not adapted.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a character from the unadapted 'Hatchan's Sea Floor Stroll' cover story.

reveals.information: Works as a takoyaki vendor on Fish-Man Island
